question: Who represented India addressed the first-ever Ministerial Meeting of G-20 Anti-Corruption Working Group?
explanation:
Union minister Jitendra Singh represented India in the first-ever Ministerial Meeting of G-20 Anti-Corruption Working Group.
The Minister attended the meeting through video conference. During his address, he said that India is committed to the policy of zero tolerance against corruption and unaccounted money. He also mentioned about India's Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988.
